Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries/Prelude/Relation
Synopsis Library functions for relations.
Usage import Relation;
Details carrier carrierR carrierX complement distribution domain domainR domainX groupDomainByRange groupRangeByDomain ident index invert range rangeR rangeX toMap
Description Operations on Relations are describing in Values/Relation. All operations on Values/Set are also applicable to relations.

The following functions are provided on relations:
  • carrier: Return the set of all elements in any tuple in a relation.
  • carrierR: A relation restricted to certain element values in tuples.
  • carrierX: A relation excluding tuples that contain certain element values.
  • complement: Complement of a relation.
  • distribution:
  • domain: Domain of a relation: a set consisting of the first element of each tuple.
  • domainR: Relation restricted to certain domain elements.
  • domainX: Relation excluding certain domain values.
  • groupDomainByRange: Make sets of elements in the domain that relate to the same element in the range.
  • groupRangeByDomain: Make sets of elements in the range that relate to the same element in the domain.
  • ident: The identity relation.
  • index: Indexes a binary relation as a map
  • invert: Invert the tuples in a relation.
  • range: The range (i.e., all but the first element of each tuple) of a relation.
  • rangeR: Relation restricted to certain range values.
  • rangeX: Relation excluding certain range values.
  • toMap:

Questions
Question [1]. Fill in the missing function name. 
({<-17, "Strawberry">, <0, "Yoda">, <-19, "Kiwifruit">, <16, "E">}) == {<"E",16>,<"Kiwifruit",-19>,<"Yoda",0>,<"Strawberry",-17>}

Question [2]. Fill in the missing function name. 
({<"Isolder", -14>, <"Jar Jar Binks", -4>}) == {-4,-14}

Question [3]. Fill in the missing function name. 
({3, 6, 9}) == {<3,3>,<6,6>,<9,9>}

Question [4]. Fill in the missing function name. 
({<"Gooseberry", -1>, <"Prince Charming", 19>, <"U", -2>}) == {"Gooseberry","U","Prince Charming"}

Question [5]. Fill in the missing function name. 
({<"Forgetful Jones", -7>, <"Bert", -12>, <"A", 18>, <"Zekk", 17>}) == {"Zekk",-7,"Forgetful Jones","Bert",-12,18,"A",17}
